name: Jason Nicklaus
text: My family recently rented a unit here and honestly in my experience most all storage units are about the same. Our deciding factor to rent here was the service we received by Debbie along with appearance and cleanliness of the property. She took the time to show us the unit and ask questions to make sure the space we looked at would be the correct size for our needs. That may seem like a given but other places in the area made it seem like a chore to show us the rental space if they showed it at all. Debbie also took the time to make certain we had the packing materials we needed and made suggestions on packing materials we were not aware of. Debbie also did a great job at explaining the lease and the services we were paying for. This place while similar wasn't the cheapest we inquired about but the service provided by Debbie along with the cleanliness of the property by far made this the best value in the area in my opinion.

resp.text: Thanks, Jason Nicklaus, for leaving us a five-star review! It's great to hear that we were all you expected and more. We select, train and coach our team around the idea that customers deserve memorable and positive experiences. As such, we are delighted to read how our staff delivered above and beyond your expectations. We sincerely look forward to serving you time after time. Looking forward to your next visit, your friends at iStorage.

name: Zach J
text:
I stored some furniture and appliances in a 10' x 10' outdoor storage unit here from April 2018 through November 2018 while searching for a house. I had a great experience with the staff and facility, and I will recommend them to anyone I know looking for storage.

Moving in was a breeze. Entering and exiting the facility through the secure gate is easy peasy, and there's tons of room to maneuver a large truck to unload your stuff straight into your storage unit.

All of my things were in great shape when I moved out. My storage unit was clean and in proper order when I moved in and moved out. I didn't have any issues with pests or vermin taking residence in my stuff or the storage unit.

The staff are incredibly friendly, fastidious, and accomodating. If you have any questions, they'll give you a straight answer, and they're really on top of their game when it comes to keeping the place in tip top shape.

Long story short: this is a great place to keep your stuff.

resp.text:
Hey Zach, we are very happy to hear that you had a great experience when renting with us. This is exactly what we expect when customers walk through our doors, and it is very reassuring to hear what we are doing right. If there is anything we could have done to give you a better experience, please reach out to us at feedback@istorage.com.

Sincerely,
iStorage Madison Jetplex

text: This place is amazing. My wife, kids, and I pulled in after a long move/unloading, coming from ATL. Talk about being part of the solution instead of part of the problem! Made me want to look for stuff in the new garage just to store with them for their wonderful way of doing business. They get it, and they understand good business practices- that's rare these days...

name: Nick Beadle
text: Wasn't pleased about the month notice they gave me about increasing the rent fee.  Basically suggesting pay the increase or leave.  Management sucks.... In-store and District.  Called customer care line and was told either one will call me... never happened.

resp.text: Hi Nick Beadle , the staff at iStorage Laceys Spring take our reviews very seriously and we appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns with us. It is thanks to feedback like yours that we can tackle issues that may impact our most valuable asset; our customers. I have sent your comments to the management at iStorage Laceys Spring for review and you should have received a call from the District Manager to discuss your concerns. We value all our customers and work hard to keep our prices competitive and fair. Unfortunately, operating cost such as property taxes, insurance, maintenance, utilities, overhead, etc. are not stable and increase year over year.  For us to maintain excellent service levels we must pass along a portion of those increases to our customers.  In addition, unlike several of our competitors who raise rents every couple of months, we process increases annually.  We are continuing to make improvements throughout the facility including asphalt, paint and building repairs to ensure that your experience at iStorage is the best possible. We look forward to serving you in the future. If there is anything more we can do to improve your experience please email us at info@istorage.com or give us a call toll free at 844-311-2342. Best Regards, the iStorage Team.

text: Overall we had a good experience reserving and moving in.  The facility is clean, well lit, and seems safe enough that I wouldn't mind going by myself or in the evenings. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was that I had a few issues with the call-line.  They were having computer issues and it took quite a while to reserve the unit. We got disconnected multiple times and had to repeat information over and over because the computer kept shutting down.  They were very apologetic and always called back promptly. I'm sure this was an isolated issue and I thought they handled it well considering it was frustrating for them as well. I would definitely recommend them to friends.

text: Mr. Charles is freaking awesome.  I was headed to Alabama from Georgia and my back passenger tire was blown out.  He was very kind, patient and very helpful.  He looked at the tire and did an assessment.  He attempted to put air in it but later realized that the inner tire was blown.  It was difficult for me to find a shop that had 24in tires on hand.  Well, Mr. Charles saved the day . He called around until he found a spot that had the tire.  Needless to say he towed me there with a smile and we had a good conversation.  Thanks so much Mr. Charles.  I appreciate you.  Have a Merry Christmas!!!!

name: David Dorris
text:
This was the worst "secure" storage facility I have ever used. The doors were propped open regularly, they
had people living in the units that were not locked and they knew it because it had been reported. Now they are rebuilding the secure units but have made no attempt to settle any disputes with the renters when the units burned to the ground. The video cameras were not working  and homeless people were living in the open  units at night when no one was around.
This place sucks.
signed - Lost everything in three large units.
They have made no effort to settle.

name: Devin Cothern
text: I had a storage unit for a few months then this unit burned completely down.  Two units down from mine, a guy & lady were living in it. I reported this numerous times with no action. After this unit burned down, they said they didn't receive my paperwork i had completed prior, for my extra insurance. They offered myself & everyone else $2,000. This is a joke. This company is negligent & they proved it. My aunt had a red dot storage on schillinger rd that got broken into as well & they didn't offer anything. They told her "they didn't have cameras" . If you care about your belongings, I would NOT DARE  put your stuff in any of these facilities.

Believe CS agent Robert set everything up for me.Very knowledgeable professional to have on your team.

name: Amber Sinclair
text: not a fan

resp.text: We apologize for any issues you've experienced and would love to offer a resolution. In order to provide you the best customer experience however, we need more information. Please contact us at (855) 733-3681 so that we can ensure you're receiving the best possible care. Thank you!

name: Peggy Adams (Pooh)
text: I would rent from them again.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review Peggy and we appreciate your business!

name: osareafallire
text:
UPDATE: I set a calendar reminder 3 days and 1 day prior to my bill being due. On both days I checked my account balance. It was $0.00.
Six days later I received a text message advising me to pay my bill to avoid late fees. I logon the SAME day to make my payment and see that I've ALREADY been charged a late fee. In other words, they give you five days out of 30 during which to pay your bill without avoiding a late fee.

Oh, also, apparently there's a door in the back that always remains open and unlocked next to a fence that's about 3 feet high so all of their security systems either don't work when they should or do work when the shouldn't.
- the exit gate that has worked 2 weeks out of 4 months I've been there
- I've been given 4 gate codes which have been turned off without warning or notification
- There's no CERTAIN number of days during which the property manager is required to remove the lockout on your storage unit if you don't pay your bill within those 5 days. It certainly ISN'T the SAME or NEXT day which would be the case if there were an attendant. But then if there were an attendant that back door probably wouldn't remain open and unlocked.

The first night I got there I will admit the customer service agent was pretty helpful getting me into the unit since neither the gate code I was given or the building code worked for me. They were able to get me inside after a couple calls and they were nice enough so kudos for that.

I think this is the only company I've ever had to deal with that doesn't send you a bill before they send you a late charge. Red Dot conveniently reminds you of your monthly payment...the same day they charge you the late fee. I've never received an invoice or payment reminder prior to the late notice which I receive via text message and email.

I've also received text messages telling me when the gate will be closed for holidays and stuff. The message I'm getting is they want you to know when you can't get to your stuff and they want you to know once they've charged you a late fee but don't want to notify you when your bill should be paid on time. No worries, I've set a reminder of my own so sorry, you'll have to do without the extra $10 you've been accustomed to receiving.

The exit gate has been broken for almost 2 months. For a while it would still open automatically when you drove up to it but it could still be pulled or pushed open from either side. Now there's just a big chain around it. They could probably have had it repaired for the amount they've charged me in late fees but they're probably too busy slapping red pad locks on units they've yet to send out a late notice on.

name: Rebecca Eskridge
text: The facility is clean, easy to access, and the customer service via phone was wonderful! They offer a 5$ discount for auto pay which I was happy to sign up for!

name: Betty Longoria
text: This place was a joke the day we were moving our things into climate control the lock was broken!! we COULDNT even get in then they said we could put into a non climate control but we had valuable items that couldn't not be in a non climate control. They COULDNT even give us a date or time frame as to when it would be fixed. Then I just got a bill!!?? hello I NEVER left my belongings and you're going to send me a bill?? idiots!!!

Come to find out, lightning struck the place and messed the system up and wont work. IT works on it and gets it up and running the next day. I come this sunday morning to pick up the trailer and go but yet again gate wont open. Tried calling but no answer. How is it that a place like this doesnt have a 24/7 call center for stuff like this and get to working on getting this fixed when they get warnings about this kind of stuff? Very disappointing.

name: Marcus Ferguson
text:
Borderline criminal behavior and unwilling to honor their promise. We were quoted a fair price for the storage unit. We were also told that if we presented proof of our homeowners insurance (which we did) that we would avoid paying their monthly warranty fee. Well, I was unable to pay my first bill online because their website wasn't cooperating. I called and had them email my account info to me again. Still didn't work. So I called and asked if I could pay over the phone without having to pay the customer service fee they usually assess for phone payments. The lady agreed, which was great, but guess what was also included on the bill...the warranty fee!  I really didn't notice until I received the invoice for the following month, and wouldn't you know it, there is that warranty fee again! So I called the iStorage location to get it cleared up. She removed the warranty fee from the upcoming bill, but refused to credit my account for the prior month's overpayment because I paid over the phone! The way I see it, that type of behavior is, at the very least, wildly unethical, and may even be criminal.

Edit/Update: I just received a call from a nice lady from iStorage.  She apologized for the error and credited my account.  I'm still dissatisfied with the individuals at the Central Parkway location for their actions, but I'm relieved that someone from iStorage (corporate, I'm guessing) had enough integrity to make things right.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Ferguson, I hope we were able to resolve this issue to your satisfaction. We apologize for the mistake and genuinely look forward to serving you in the future, happy and satisfied customers are our number one priority. The iStorage Team.

name: Rebecca Moore
text: The price went up 4 - 5 times in the 2 years I rented a unit. Ridiculous.

resp.text: We value all our customers and work hard to keep our prices competitive and fair. Unfortunately, operating cost such as property taxes, insurance, maintenance, utilities, overhead, etc. are not stable and increase year over year.  For us to maintain excellent service levels we must pass along a portion of those increases to our customers.  In addition, unlike several of our competitors who raise rents every couple of months, we process increases annually.  We are continuing to make improvements throughout the facility including asphalt, paint and building repairs to ensure that your experience at iStorage is the best possible. We look forward to serving you in the future. If there is anything more we can do to improve your experience please email us at info@istorage.com or give us a call toll free at 844-311-2342. Best Regards, the iStorage Team.

text: I needed a storage space and decided to try Public Storage as i have had poor to "okay" experiences with other local storage companies. Kim provided excellent customer service! Yay for me! This made me feel comfortable getting a storage room and I didn't feel like number (we all know how that feels). I highly recommend this location! Thanks for being a big help with my needs, Kim!

name: Sarah Vanderford
text: I ended my lease with public storage and they continued to charge me for another month. I confirmed my lease was ended twice with a public storage employee and that I did not need to do anything else, I was payed up, and they proceeded to pass off my "bill" for another month to a debt collector. Lower management was initially helpful and confirmed that I did indeed vacate long before they said I did, and he was going to fix the issue, but then he saw it had gone to collections and there was nothing he could do with that. So he gave me the contact information for management out of Birmingham, and they never returned my calls. She answered once and the call dropped or something? And I could never get her to answer again. My fiance and I used their advertised discounts on our first two months, and ended the lease before the outrageous increase on rent the third month. We couldn't afford their regular rates. What I do know is that the company did yet again refuse to correct their mistake when I refuted the charge with the debt collector. My next step will be to pursue legal action if I can. Hopefully I do have enough proof that I did reach out and end my lease. They have hurt my credit and charged me for a space that I cancelled. Their discounts in the beginning are nice, but they will absolutely charge you for whatever they decide to. When you cancel your lease, they might simply just have "forgotten to write it down" and then refuse to fix it. I wish I could press charges. This is theft in every way.

name: Adam Sawyer
text:
Warning: Pricing will change!
This is not specific to the Leeman Ferry location.  But if you think you got a good deal on the price (online special), it will go away faster than you think.  I signed a contract for $69 per month.  Within 5 months, that price was increased to the standard price of $81 per month (a 17% increase).

I did receive a notice that stated 'In keeping with our high standards of location storage, it's occasionally necessary to make adjustments to our rates.'   However the advertised online pricing at the same time as my increase was even lower ($65 per month).

Public Storage makes sure you are fully moved into your storage unit, and then will take away any pricing deal!  They will not reduce the rate back to the original pricing.  You will have no choice but to pay the standard rate or move out.

name: Chandler Bridges
text: Okay, let me start by saying I have moved many many times. I have also had storage units for over 25 years and in all sizes, shapes, and locations. This facility in little old Florence is by far the absolute best experience I have ever had. Not only with the storage units (clean, well lit, safe, 24 hour access), but also in that this location is a U-haul renter. I have rented 10 foot, 15 foot, and 26 foot trucks with ease multiple times from these nice folks in my two years here in Florence. Also, I have taken two 12 foot trailers and a 26 foot truck on one-way adventures. Every time the equipment is ready and the service is super fast. Alex the on-site manager is by far the nicest and most accommodating employee I have ever met at a place like this. It is always a pleasure to go in and see him. Leah, his competent co-worker, is equally as pleasant and adept at getting the job done for the customer with ease. I really can’t speak highly enough about the staff at this fantastic location. I hope if Alex ever leaves this job he would consider working for me, because I know and appreciate the value of an employee that not only cares about the customer’s business but also values the interactions with them as well. Well stocked, honest, considerate and caring sums up this Chisholm road location. They get my highest recommendation.

resp.text: Dear Most Valued Customer - the staff of Midgard Self Storage on Chisholm Road in Florence Alabama sincerely thank you for providing the highest rating for customer service, cleanliness, security and 24x7 access to your RV equipment. Uncle Bob's also offers the use of a truck to help bring your belongings to the facility.  What a GREAT service!!!  Security seems very adequate with CC cameras, a locked gate, and of course, locks on your unit.  We're very pleased with our decision.

name: Sharon Morrison
text: I originally  gave this business  a 1 star review. My intent was to make the owner  understand the hardship he caused with what he called an honest  mistake. When I attempted  to access  my unit at 6:00 am the gate would not open. After multiple  attempts  and a messages  left on the answering machine I left. I returned  at 7:30 am hoping  that maybe the system was down and it had been corrected.  Unfortunately,  that was not the case. I once again left a message.  I waited until  8:00 am and called a 3rd time which he finally  answered. He had given us the the wrong code. The honest mistake caused a delay of 4 hours and additional expenses. I am disappointed  that the owner never apologized for his actions. I will say that the storage facility met our needs at the time and for that we are grateful.

resp.text: According to our phone records you called us around 7:00am Sunday morning and again at around 7:30.  The call was returned immediately at 8:32 when I received the message.  I am very sorry that you were inconvenienced by my honest mistake, but we are a small family owned business and do not have a call center.   I apologized at the time of my return call and then again when we spoke the next time.  I am human and am subject to making mistakes but will always try to do my best to rectify them.   Again, I'm very sorry that you were inconvenienced but it was an hour and a half, not 4 hours, and I've now apologized 3 separate times.   We are sorry for your experience and wish you the best moving forward.

name: Brandy Lockey
text: Having 24 hour access would be great especially for those who are not in the area all the time like myself. With our work schedules it's hard to make it there during your hours a lot of the times

resp.text: Thank you for the review.   We made the decision to limit access hours for safety purposes.  We aim to provide a safe secure environment for our tenants and their belongings.  It is for that reason that we limit access hours from 6am to 9pm.  We understand that can be an inconvenience for some people that would be coming in for the right reasons.  However, not everyone has good intentions late at night.   Unfortunately, the actions of a few have a negative impact for everyone else.   Sorry for any inconvenience.  Thank you again for the feedback.

name: Rosemary Hunter
text: I have stored with Dothan Stor N Lok for 4 years. They were fine at first but must have changed management. Due to theft out of their mailbox, you have to mail checks to a P.O. Box.  I never missed a payment in 4 years, but twice showed up with their lock on my unit.  One was a mistake on their part - wrong unit - , the other because I was ten days late with a payment. When I went to the office to have their lock removed they would only accept cash, not a debit card or a check, to remove the lock. Nevermind that I had never bounced a check in 4 years, I had to run to the bank while the movers I hired waited and the clock ticked per hour.  When I called the office on my way to the bank to check on their policy of whether they would prorate the month, Charlene said she was not going to argue with me.  I tried to explain I simply wanted to know if she would prorate the month, or not, and she hung up on me.  I asked her when I returned with cash why she hung up on me and she said she wasn’t going to argue with me.    They are not a nice management.

name: Brian Reese
text:
Not very happy with Halls Mill location. I have rent 2 10X20 storage units for the last 2 years. One is climate control and the other is not. They keep raising there rates on me every year. Just received another letter saying they are going to raise up again for the 2nd time. Customer service always has been an attitude with me.Try to pay my bills online this last month just like have always done in the past and it wouldnt let pay. So I call TK to inform her of the website not working and she care inform me that there is a service fee for them to take my credit card payment over the phone. They made me pay 2 service fees since I had 2 different units since I couldn't pay my bill online because there website not working. Why should I have to pay service fee for there screw up website. She tells me is there nothing I can do about it which is BS. I have try to call corporate number and no one has call me back. Like I said, the biggest problem I have with Halls Mill location is her attitude she gives off to me.

Also, the other day I walk thru one of the climate control units to get to my unit and the inside smelled like urine. It time for me to start looking for another place that actually treat me like a customer.

resp.text:
Hello Brian, we are sorry to hear about your difficulty with payments. We offer many ways to pay including autopay and phone payments. We have notified senior management to your concerns, and working to ensure that this situation does not happen for any other customer. If there are any other issues you would like to discuss, please reach out to us at feedback@istorage.com.

Sincerely,
The iStorage Team

name: John Sullivan
text:
Have a storage unit there that Mother N law and i have had for approximately ten years.  My husbands belongings from his divorce are in it and my mother in law has been paying it.  She is 83 years old and has had a stroke.  I have been paying her bills since August.  The guy there knows that i pay the bill.  I've never been called for a late bill and as I live in her house now to provide her care, i would know if she had been called. It's never been late.   Now they are calling and harrassing her for money because a LATE fee will be added on TOMORROW.  I tried to call Yesterday and NO ONE would answer.  I've paid it on the 5th of EVERY month since I've been paying the bills and I get a woman....(always been a very nice man in the past) who is a witch and says she is the manager.  I became angry with her and asked her what I needed to do to close agreement out as I was going to come get my things out of the unit.  She said my mother in law would have to come there to do it.  She KNOWS my mother in law is bed ridden and can't handle the account.  I even got my mother in olaw to tell her she could discuss the account with me...........she insists that SHE has to come by to sign off on the contract.  She advised my mother in law that she set her up on AUTO PAY.  I promise you I will have a new Debit card and I dare her to try to charge anything on this account.  They won't get one more dime out of me!!!

Since I can't respond to the response I received on this.....I will say that My husband IS ON THE LEASE.  It is HIS belongings.  My mother in law just use to pay it.  And "Witch" was a nice way of saying so much more.......... She was awful and lost long term customers...not to mention, i discourage anyone from using this location.

resp.text: Hi John, My name is Evan. I am not a manager but I am part of the support staff at iStorage. I think there is some misunderstanding because we cannot give out customer information to someone who isn't on the lease...and you can't cancel a lease if you aren't on it. If you can have Wanda add her daughter-in-law to the lease, then she can have control of the account. Since Wanda can't come down to the facility, she has the ability to add her daughter-in-law to the lease over the phone. If you have any other questions please give me a call at 805-570-5528. Also, please do not call our manager a "witch" - we can get everything resolved without the name calling.

name: junk can
text: Having been involved in recreational boating or commercial shipping nearly my whole life of almost 50 years, I can eagerly attest that Nelson Boatyard is a bright spot in the South for commercial and recreational boaters to service their vessels!  The very affordable rates make the location a win to begin with.  The massive capacity of this large and expanding boatyard is another positive, though they graciously made room for me even in the midst of the fallout of Hurricane Sally .  However, perhaps the best aspect of the facility are the brilliant array of professionals associated with it who are able to attend to any matter that one might face.  Though I intended to perform all the work on my boat, I was delighted to find both excellent, generous guidance and reliable, experienced service providers to attend to all my needs that were beyond my own capacity.  I suppose that is to be expected from a business operated by four generations of one family!   I will be gladly returning from Pensacola for routine maintenance every two years!

name: Leigh Baker
text:
HORRIBLE experience!!!!!
My unit was broken into and several boxes and a TV were stolen!
On top of that, someone else's box of belongings was in my unit!!!
So, obviously, someone else had been broken into and the thief left what they didn't want from them in my unit!!!!!

There was no one in the office for me to turn that box in to so that the owner of the box could look for it!
There was no one to personally help me! No one local!
The person I talked to on the phone was in another State!!!

No cameras because "someone" turned them away from where they were supposed to be watching! Red Dot had NO IDEA that the cameras were turned because they did not have anyone checking them on a daily basis!
I personally turned the cameras back to how they should have been, but every time I returned, the cameras were moved again!!!

I am SO disappointed and sad at the loss of my personal and very sentimental items!!!! You have to have a code to get into the place!!!!! My belongings should have been safe and protected! That's what I paid for!!!!

name: Keandra Lee
text:
Very very disappointed and dissatisfied. My storage constantly broken into. I walked in today to see my belongings on the top of my storage. Will be moving from here ASAP!

I DO NOT RECOMMEND MOVING YOUR BELONGINGS HERE!!!!

name: David Huneycutt
text:
Not very secure. Beware.
Edit...
Guys it wasn't so much the fact that the unit was broken into, (that was bad enough) but I had to move your security cameras 4 times after our break-in. It would be moved to not show the entrance every time. I called at least 5 times and nothing was done, I would just keep moving the camera back. Then, one day I saw a Reddot truck there and stopped him and told him the story. He promised he would contact the site manager. I never got a call. Your call center is in the Philippines. Need I say more?

resp.text: Hi David. We apologize that you have experienced a break-in. We take facility security very seriously and are always working to ensure something like this does not occur. Since you were affected by the break-in, please call us at (855) 733-3681 and choose option #5 to speak with our Coverage Specialist.

text: Great rates and convenient but they need to replace the burned out lights in the facility.  It was so dark, I could not see my lock.

name: Brian Bradford
text: Ceiling lights out everywhere, was told our responsibility to change red dots light bulbs. Bathroom isn't usable at all. Ac doesn't work

resp.text: Hi Brian. We're really sorry. The bathroom onsite will never be available for customer use, as we are unable to provide constant upkeep, as is needed with public restrooms. We have made some staffing adjustments and are going to fix this! We appreciate your patience.

name: Jordan Downing
text: I paid extra for a climate controlled storage unit after moving from another state. I have called and complained TWICE because it is hotter in the storage unit than it is outside. It has been 95°+ outside and no one seems to care. I have spent thousands of dollars on my belongings in the unit and I would not have paid EXTRA for a climate controlled unit just for my belongings to get ruined due to the lack of care from the employees at Red Dot. Worst experience I have ever had with a storage facility.

text: I located this company online.  The representative I spoke did not tell me about a move-in special.  I found out about the special the first time I visited my unit from a banner hanging at the entrance.  When I called the company to inquire about the move-in special they did not want to offer it to me because I did not mention the special when I signed the rental contract.  The company did come back later and offer me the special.  I am very pleased with the facility.  It is very clean and I feel secure while I am there.

text: I have a unit with Red Dot by default once they acquired my old storage facility Eastdale Self Storage. I must admit I'm truly sad to see the old people leave not just for their friendliness and helpfulness but ever since the acquisition, my price has been steadily going up month after month with no new added benefits or explanation and I can't wait to get my things away from there. I'm honestly only doing this review to hopefully receive a $5 credit towards my bill this month until I leave but my thoughts are true and honest sadly. I hope others may be able to find a better experience than I have based off of this review. Unit #49.
